definition: to ascend/to rise to the rank of/to promote/to hoist/liter/measure for dry grain equal to one-tenth dou 斗[dou3]
radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 4)/see 撇[pie3]
to escalate (in intensity)/to go up by one grade/to be promoted/to upgrade (computing)
to rise again after a fall/to pick up/rally (stock market etc)
to clamber up/(of prices etc) to rise
to become hot/temperature rise/(fig.) to intensify/to hot up/to escalate/to get a boost
to promote to a higher position
to enter the next grade school
to sublimate/sublimation (physics)/to raise to a higher level/to refine/promotion
to raise a flag/to hoist a flag
see 直升機|直升机[zhi2 sheng1 ji1]

sentences.english: A gun shot suddenly pealed forth and shot its flames into the air.
sentences.chinese: 突然一聲炮響，一道火光升上天空。

sentences.english: The water was rising quickly and the tub was almost full.
sentences.chinese: 水很快就升起來，浴盆差不多滿了。

sentences.english: The sun was coming out of the horizon. First it was just a ray of light.
sentences.chinese: 太陽已經升出地平線了，首先是一道光。

sentences.english: Improved Fire Blast now is a Tier 2 Talent. Up from Tier 1.
sentences.chinese: 強化火焰衝擊由一階天賦升爲二階天賦。

sentences.english: A national flag is always flown higher than other flags.
sentences.chinese: 國旗永遠都要升於別的旗幟之上。

sentences.english: Work term, often sing with the yellow rose.
However, my father didn't come to us until the moon rise on the treetop.
sentences.chinese: 那晚，父親一直到月亮都已經升上樹梢了纔回到家裏。

sentences.english: This 4-seat sedan is powered by a 6.0-litre V12 behemoth.
sentences.chinese: 這輛四座轎車的發動機是恐怖的6升V字型12缸。

sentences.english: Market-watchers had forecast the Link's share price would rise up to 10 per cent on its debut.
sentences.chinese: 市場人士原預期領匯股價會在上市首日升百分之十。

sentences.english: Smoke from the camp-fires spiraled up into a clear sky.
sentences.chinese: 營火冒出的煙嫋嫋升上明淨的天空。

sentences.english: It' s a development of Big Boss.
sentences.chinese: 是“大老闆”的升六合彩網站級。

sentences.english: By 2020, the Chinese government wants that figure to fall to 5 litres.
sentences.chinese: 中國政府希望到2020年將百公里耗油量降至5升。

sentences.english: Raise blood sugar, stimulate catabolism, the hormone that mobilizes nutriment.
sentences.chinese: 升血糖，促進分解代謝，爲營養物質動員激素。

sentences.english: I'm sorry Mr. Ting, but we can't promote you until your English improves.
sentences.chinese: 對不起，丁先生，我們要等你的英文進步了才能升你。

sentences.english: Murky brown water grows to roof tops and lapped around the high-rises.
sentences.chinese: 渾濁的棕色河水已經升到屋頂，拍打着高樓大廈。

sentences.english: I want to promote you to be Senior Studying Companion.
sentences.chinese: 我決定升你爲高級伴讀書僮。

definition: to clamber up/(of prices etc) to rise
to decline/to drop/to fall/to go down/to decrease
to leap to (a higher position etc)/to jump/(of a plane) to ascend
Li (c. 2000 BC), sixth of the legendary Flame Emperors 炎帝[Yan2 di4] descended from Shennong 神農|神农[Shen2 nong2] Farmer God, also known as Ai 哀[Ai1]
low/beneath/to lower (one's head)/to let droop/to hang down/to incline
to rise again after a fall/to pick up/rally (stock market etc)
